s.text: ( The New Yorker wrote about this topic a month ago.)
Clinton's advisers, who used to protect him by spinning and covering up his wrongdoing, have turned skeptical.
It's too late for strong GOP candidates to emerge this year, and voter turnout won't be depressed by Clinton's departure.
The cover editorial reassures readers that a global depression is highly unlikely as long as the American economy stays strong.
The anti-draft protestors who trumpeted "Power to the People" were college-educated elitists themselves, and these rebels of yesteryear now embrace the system as today's leaders.

Russia 1, Old Media 0.) Newsweek 's Russia coverage includes sketches of the new Russian political players plus a profile of shady oligarch Boris Berezovsky.

How is it, the piece asks, that liberals who relentlessly vilified Nixon have suddenly decided that Clinton's lying is irrelevant?
